titlestmt.subtitle: Papers of Aliki Dora Barnstone, 1968-2010, at the Lilly Library, Indiana University
titlestmt.author: Mary McSparran

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-02-18 21:56:15 -0500.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

change.item: Edits and rearrangement of content into requisite Lilly EAD structure, including addition of abstract, bioghist, scopecontent, controlaccess, relatedmaterial, and c01 levels of container list. Madison Chartier.
Encoded finding aid completed. Madison Chartier.

did.abstract: The Barnstone, A. mss., 1968-, consists of the poems and correspondence of poet Aliki Dora Barnstone, 1956-.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.
Many collections are housed offsite; retrieval requires advance notice. Please make an appointment a minimum of one week in advance of your visit.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Photography and digitization may be restricted for some collections. Copyright restrictions may apply. Before publishing, researchers are responsible for securing permission from all applicable rights holders, then filling out the Permission to Publish form.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Aliki Barnstone was born in Connecticut in September 1, 1956, to painter Elli Tzalodoulou and poet Willis Barnstone. Her family moved to Bloomington, Indiana, in 1962. Barnstone began writing poetry when she was seven years old, and her first volume of verse, The Real Tin Flower, which has an introduction by Anne Sexton, was published when she was twelve. Barnstone has since published multiple collections of poetry and translations. She completed her A.B. in Semiotics at Brown University in 1980, her A.M. in English at Brown in 1983, and her Ph.D. in English at UC-Berkeley in 1995. She teaches English and creative writing at the University of Missouri.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection includes letters largely from editors and writers, among whom are Aliki Barnstone, Sandra Blake, Gloria D. (Bradley) Durán, Edward Kern, Helen Lothrop, Juan Marichal, David Eugene Ray, Solita Solinas de Marichal, Anne (Harvey) Sexton, Sally Sowell, George Starbuck, Carolyn Trager, and Rosmarie Waldrop.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged following original order.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Barnstone, A. mss., Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.
